power supply
volume)

board.

timeout occurs

or

board.

Cause:
The CU FW in
NAND FLASH
has not been
detected, or a
check SUM error
has occurred.

Power OFF/ON
or
Replace the Printer controller
board.

Cause:
CU Font ROM
Hash Error
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
or
Replace the Printer controller
board.

Cause:
CU RAM Check
Error
The CE1 ASIC
equipped
apparatus
displays the sub
number for the
detected part.
01: resident
(CPU) RAM
02: CE1 Main
RAM
03: CE1 sub
RAM
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
or
Replace the Printer controller
board.

Cause:
CU EEPROM
Error
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
or
Replace the Printer controller
board.

Cause:
Flash File
System Error
Remedial measure:
Run forced initialization of
Flash. (Note that NIC- F/W is
deleted. After the initialization,
it is need to written the NIC-F/
W by the Maintenance utility.)
Replace the Printer controller
board if symptom does not
change.

Cause:
Flash File
System Error
Remedial measure:
Run forced initialization of
Flash. (Note that NIC- F/W is
deleted. After the initialization,
it is need to written the NIC-F/
W by the Maintenance utility.)
Replace the Printer controller
board if symptom does not
change.

Cause:
Flash File
System Error
Remedial measure:
Run forced initialization of
Flash. (Note that NIC- F/W is
deleted. After the initialization,
it is need to written the NIC-F/
W by the Maintenance utility.)
Replace the Printer controller
board if symptom does not
change.

Cause:
4/5 Color
configuration
error
Check details:
Sub board was
mismatched with 4/5
color setting in the CU
board.
Remedial measure:
1) Install or uninstall the Sub
board.
2) Replace the Printer
controller board with correct
4/5 color setting to match the
Engine.

Cause:
CU Fan Error
Abnormal CPU
cooling fan on
CU board.
(PDL only)
Remedial measure:
Is CU Fan connector set
properly?
If yes, replace fan.
Is error recovered by
replacing fan?
If no, replace the printer controller board

Cause:
DMA Abort
Error detected
in Image
processor.
(PDL only)
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
or
Replace the Printer controller
board.

Cause:
The controller
unit detects
the HDD is not
mounted to the
apparatus that
is mounted it
necessary.
Remedial measure:
Power OFF and mount the
HDD. And Power ON.

Cause:
SleepMode
Interface Monitor
I/F error with CU
F/W.
Remedial measure:
If power cycling does not solve
the problem, maintenance by
a service engineer is required.

Cause:
The NIC device
had not worked
correctly.
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
or
Replace the Printer controller
board.

Cause:
Post Script
firmware fault
was detected.
(PDL only)

Power OFF/ON
or

board.

Engine I/F error

or

Cause:
01:In3
Transmission
Sensor
Calibration
Error
02:In3 Reflect
Sensor
Calibration
Error
03:Cutter In
Transmission
Sensor
Calibration
Error
04:Cutter In
Reflect
Sensor
Calibration
Error
05:Unwinder
Slack Sensor
Error
Remedial measure:
Check the open circuit of
the sensor cable and any
abnormal for the sensor.

Cause:
Detected illegal
Unit Error
03: Unwinder
Check details:
An unsupported version
unit was detected.
Remedial measure:
Remove the unit after Power
OFF.
If the unit conforms to the
apparatus and this error is
displayed, maintenance by a
service engineer is required.

Cause:
High-voltage
power supply I/F
error.
Remedial measure:
Is cable between PU
board and high-voltage
power unit connected
properly? If no connect properly.
Is there no improperly
connections? If yes check improper connections for high-voltage. If no replace the high-voltage power supply

Cause:
Abnormal
environment
humidity /Not
connected
humidity sensor.
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON or
Replace the Environment
board or
Replace the Printer controller
board

Cause:
Abnormal
environment
temperature.
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON or
Replace the Environment
board or
Replace the Printer controller
board

Cause:
Condensation in
the printer was
detected.
Check details:
Condensation is likely to
occur in printers carried
from the outside.
Turn on the printer again
after it is exposed to
room temperature for
two hours to half a day.
Remedial measure:
Turn on the printer again after
it is left alone or
Replace the Environment
board or
Replace the Printer controller
board.

Cause:
01: Fuser
exhaust
Fan1 Error, 
02: Power
Supply Front
Fan Eror, 
03: Engine Fan
Error, 
05: ID Fan1(White
Drum Fan)
Error, 
0A: Fuser intake
Fan Error, 
0B: ID Fan2
(Yellow
Drum Fan)
Error, 
0D: Fuser
exhaust
Fan2 Error, 
0E: ID Fan3
(Magenta
Drum Fan)
Error, 
0F: ID Fan4
(Cyan Drum
Fan) Error, 
10: ID Fan5
(Black Drum
Fan) Error, 
11: Unwinder
Fan Error
Remedial measure:
Correct the connection. or
Replace the FAN. or
Replace the board:
01: Driver relay board
02: Driver relay board
03: Driver relay board
05: Main board
0A: Driver relay board
0B: Main board
0D: Driver relay board
0E: Main board
0F: Main board
10: Main board
11: Option board

Cause:
LED head fault
detected.
(01 = K, 02 = C,
03 = M, 04 =Y,
05 = W)
Remedial measure:
Set properly for LED head
unit.
Power OFF/ON.
Replace LED head unit
Replace the board.
134-01 to 04:
Printer controller board
134-05: Sub board

Cause:
07: Belt Motor
Lock Error
Remedial measure:
Remove the Belt unit.
Dose the motor drive by
the motor test?
Yes: Replace the Belt Unit.
No: Check the following motor and board.
Dose not the mechanism
abnormal of the fuse cut
or the broken gear etc
lie?
Yes: Replace the motor or the belt
motor driving mechanism.
No: Replace the Printer controller
board.

Cause:
09: Fuser Motor
Lock Error
Remedial measure:
Remove the Fuser and
Exit unit. Does the motor
drive by the motor test?
Yes: Replace the Fuser and Exit
Unit.
No: Check the following motor and board.
Does not the mechanism
abnormal of the fuse cut
of the motor, the open /
short circuit of the motor
or the broken gear etc
lie?
Yes: Replace the motor or
the Fuser motor driving
mechanism.
No: Replace the Printer controller
board.

Cause:
11: ID Motor
Lock Error
Remedial measure:
Remove the Print
Cartridge. Does the
motor drive by the motor
test?
Yes: Replace the Print Cartridge.
No: Check the following motor and
board.
Does not the mechanism
abnormal of the fuse cut
of the motor?
Yes: Replace the motor.
No: Replace the driver relay
board.
Does error reoccur?
Yes: Replace the DC_Motor(ID)
driving mechanism.

Cause:
20: Fuser
Rotate
Sensor
Error
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
Replace the Fuser and Exit
Unit.
Service Call 136 occurs after
power ON.
Does error reoccur after
replacing the Fuser and
Exit Unit?
Replace the Printer controller
board

Cause:
21:Fuser Rotate
Sensor
Short Error
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
Replace the Fuser and Exit
Unit.
Does error reoccur after
replacing the Fuser and
Exit Unit?
Check the Fuser rotate detect
sensor, the driver relay board
and the Printer controller
board

Cause:
22: Fuser
Rotate
Sensor
Open Error
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
Replace the Fuser and Exit
Unit.
Does error reoccur after
replacing the Fuser and
Exit Unit?
Check the Fuser rotate detect
sensor, the driver relay board
and the Printer controller
board

Cause:
02: Fuser
Unit High
temperature
latch error
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
Replace the Fuser and Exit
Unit.
Does error reoccur after
replacing the Fuser and
Exit Unit?
Replace the Printer controller
board

Cause:
LED Head
Power Error
01: Head Power
error of the
main board
02: Head Power
error of the
Sub board
Remedial measure:
01: Does the fuse F25,
F125 or F128 on
the Printer controller
board open?
Replace the Printer controller
board.
02: Does the fuse F1
or F2 on the Sub
board open?
Replace the Sub board.

Cause:
Cutter unit
fuse cannot be
disconnected.
Remedial measure:
Does the fuse F3 on the
Option board open?
Yes: Replace the Option board.

Cause:
The power
supply
thermistor is
detected an
abnormal.
01 : The power
supply
thermistor is
detected as
shorted.
02 : The power
supply
thermistor is
detected as
open.
03 : The power
supply
thermistor
indicates
high
temperature
error.
04 : The power
supply
thermistor
indicates
low
temperature
error.
Remedial measure:
Check that the
resistance value is about
10kΩ with contacting the
both end of RT201 on
the power supply board.
No: Replace the power supply
board.

Cause:
Thermistor
Slope Error
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
Replace the Fuser and Exit
Unit.
Service Call 136 occurs after
power ON.
Does error reoccur after
replacing the Fuser and
Exit Unit?
Replace the Printer controller
board

Cause:
Compensation
Thermistor Error
01: Short circuit
of the
thermistor for
compensation
of the upper
thermo pile
02: Open circuit
of the
thermistor for
compensation
of the upper
thermo pile
03: High
temperature
error of the
thermistor for
compensation
of the upper
thermo pile
04: Low
temperature
error of the
thermistor for
compensation
of the upper
thermo pile
11: Short circuit
of the
thermistor for
compensation
of the lower
thermo pile
12: Open circuit
of the
thermistor for
compensation
of the lower
thermo pile
13: High
temperature
error of the
thermistor for
compensation
of the lower
thermo pile
14: Low
temperature
error of the
thermistor for
compensation
of the lower
thermo pile
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON
Replace the Fuser and Exit
Unit.
Service Call 136 occurs after
power ON.
Does error reoccur after
replacing the Fuser and
Exit Unit?
Replace the Printer controller
board

Power OFF/ON
Replace the Fuser and Exit
Unit.
Service Call 136 occurs after
power ON.
Does error reoccur after
replacing the Fuser and
Exit Unit?
Replace the Printer controller
board

Cause:
41: Short circuit
of the Belt
thermistor
42: Open circuit
of the Belt
thermistor
43: High
temperature
error of the
Belt thermistor
Remedial measure:
Check that the
resistance value is about
10kΩ for the both end of
the Belt thermistor cable
disconnected from the
Printer controller board.
No: Replace the Belt thermistor.

Cause:
51: Short circuit
of the 2nd
transfer
thermistor
52: Open circuit
of the 2nd
transfer
thermistor
Remedial measure:
Check that the
resistance value is
about 10kΩ for the
both end of the 2nd
transfer thermistor cable
disconnected from the
THERM connector of
Driver relay board.
No: Replace the TR2-Sub-Assy.

board and PU board. Then
Power OFF/ON.

Cause:
Secure File
Erasing Error
Check details:
An encrypted file
deletion error has been
detected.
Has the user accepted
execution of HDD
ERASE?
Remedial measure:
Notifies users of the necessity
of running Disk ERASE for
encrypted file deletion to
format the HDD.

Cause:
Secure Disk
Erasing Error
Check details:
An error was detected
in the Disk ERASE
process.
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON or
Replace the HDD

Cause:
An unexcepted
error occurred
during
initializing the
security mode.
Error cause
information was
displayed after
an error number
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON or
Recreates an encryption
key. If the problem remains
unsolved, replace the CU
board.

Cause:
An unexcepted
error occurred
during initializing
an hard disk.
Error cause
information was
displayed after
an error number.
Remedial measure:
Power OFF/ON or
Formats the HDD again. If the
problem remains unsolved,
replace the HDD.

board and PU board. Then
